RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Professor Titular da UFPE. Presidente Vitalicio da Associao Brasileira de Alergia e Imunologia (ASBAI) - Binio 2021-2022. Coordenador da Ps-Graduao em Sade da Criana e do Adolescente da Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (UFPE) de 2017- at abril 2022, sendo atualmente vice-coordenador. Membro da Ps-Graduao em Sade Translacional da UFPE. Representante das Ps-Graduaes do Centro de Cincias Mdicas da UFPE no Conselho Universitrio. Lder do Grupo de Pesquisas do CNPQ intitulado Centro de Pesquisas em Alergia e Imunologia da UFPE - com mais de 15 pesquisadores, e de insero internacional pois atualmente certificado pela World Allergy Organization como de Excelncia em Pesquisa e Ensino (ADCARE, UCARE). Nos ltimos 5 anos orientou 9 alunos Bolsistas de Iniciao Cientfica, 7 alunos de Mestrado, 5 alunos de Doutorado e 1 aluno de Ps-doutorado, tendo neste perodo publicado mais de 35 artigos completos indexados na base de dados PubMed (24 nos ltimos 3 anos) e 1 registro de Patente. Realiza pesquisa integrada ao ensino com a assistncia e o treinamento em servio, e assim criou a Primeira e nica Residncia Mdica em Alergia e Imunologia Clnica do Norte Nordeste do pas. Doutor em Medicina pela Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1998) e atualmente Professor Titular. Tem experincia na rea de Medicina, com nfase em Alergologia e Imunologia Clnica e Pediatria, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Asma, Rede de IgE, Alergia Alimentar, Rinite Alrgica, e Dermatite Atpica, entre outros. Consultor ad hoc de Instituies Pblicas de Fomento Pesquisa. Como Presidente atual da ASBAI, juntamente com a diretoria cientfica, faz a programao de educao continuada da instituio, tendo o ltimo congresso de alergia e imunologia recebido o Prmio DoCtalks de melhor evento cientfico, bem como ainda editor dos Arquivos de Asma, Alergia e Imunologia. Entre as atividades na graduao, foi criador da Disciplina de Alergia e Imunologia Clnica da UFPE, divulgando e estimulando a pesquisa na rea entre os jovens estudantes. Em relao integrao ensino-pesquisa-assistncia, essencial na grande rea de Medicina, o Supervisor responsvel pela Residncia Mdica em Alergia e Imunologia Clnica da UFPE (desde 2011). Membro da American Academy of Asthma, Allergy and Clinical Immunology e da European Academy of Alllergy Asthma and Immunology e tem trabalhos com pesquisadores estrangeiros como Phillip Cooper (London School) e Lus Taborda Barata (Universidade Covilh-Portugal) e outros, em colaborao internacional. Faz assessoria cientfica a vrios peridicos Internacionais (Allergologia et Immunopathologia, Acta Tropica, Experta Mdica, Pediatrics, Pediatric Allergy and Immunology, WAO Journal, entre outros). Escreveu e Foi editor de mais de 5 livros eletrnicos na rea de Alergia e Imunologia nos ltimos 2 anos, e tem sido editor de outros 5 livros impressos que encontram-se em lanamento ainda este semestre de 2022 Foi Gestor e Pesquisador Principal de mais dois Projetos de Pesquisas com financiamento pelo CNPQ em trmino recente. Possui vrios artigos publicados em Alergia e Imunologia. Apresenta interesse especial em pesquisar sobre a provvel influncia do paradigma do pensamento sistmico e da salutognese nas doenas imunoalergicas, o que poder vir a ser considerado como alvo de planejamento estratgico operacional nesta modalidade de doenas crnicas facilitando a preveno e mantendo-as sob controle na viso integralizadora do Sistema nico de Sade (SUS). Atualmente com estudos na area de salutogenese
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: master's at Paediatrics from Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1988) and doctorate at Medicine from Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1998). Has experience in Medicine, focusing on Allergology and Clinical Imunology, acting on the following subjects: asma, asthma, crianas, atopia and broncoespasmo.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Food Allergy: Complementary tests help in diagnosis?

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXIII Congresso Brasileiro de Pediatria
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Arquivos de Pediatria

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Objetivos:Verificar a concordncia entre a histria clnica positiva para
alergia alimentar e os resultados dos exames complementares
realizados em crianas. Mtodos: Pacientes encaminhados com
quadro clnico suspeito de alergia alimentar, na faixa etria de
entre 1 e 5 anos de idade, foram submetidos a um questionrio
de triagem. Aps confirmao da suspeita diagnstica por esse
questionrio, as crianas foram incluidas no projeto e
realizados teste cutneo de hipersensibilidade imediata (prick
test) para casena, alfa-lactoalbumina, beta-lactoglobulina,
clara de ovo, gema de ovo, trigo e amendoim, e patch test (teste
para pesquisar alergia alimentar mediada por clulas na pele)
para protena do leite de vaca, clara de ovo, gema de ovo, trigo
e amendoim. O prick test foi considerado positivo quando a
ppula era maior que 3mm em relao ao controle negativo. O
patch test foi considerado positivo quando durante a 2 leitura
do 5 dia, ocorresse hiperemia ou edema no local de contato do
alrgeno. Resultados: Foram encaminhadas 46 crianas para o
servio. Trs delas no se enquadraram no projeto e foram
descartadas. Das 43 restantes, 25 eram do sexo masculino e 18
do feminino. Doze crianas apresentaram prick test positivo e
seis o patch test. Doze apresentaram ambos positivos. Dessa
forma, 70% das crianas apresentaram ou prick ou patch testes
positivos e 30% os dois positivos ao mesmo tempo.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Prevalncia de rinite alrgica em adolescentes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Prevalence of allergic rhinitis in Teenagers

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXXIII Congresso Brasileiro de Pediatria
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Arquivos de Pediatria

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Avaliar a prevalncia de rinite alrgica em adolescentes
de 13 e 14 anos da cidade de Caruaru localizada na
regio agreste de Pernambuco onde predomina clima semirido
quente. Mtodos: Foram randomizadas 25 escolas de um
total de 202 localizadas no municpio de Caruaru/PE, incluindo
reas urbana e rural. O sorteio aleatrio foi realizado respeitando-
se a distribuio das escolas e o nmero de alunos
matriculados por regio do municpio. Estes dados foram
fornecidos pela Secretaria de Educao local.Obteve-se
resposta de 3.026 adolescentes na faixa etria de 13 - 14 anos.
Destes, 88% residiam na zona urbana e apenas 24% eram
alunos de escolas privadas. Enquanto que os alunos da zona
rural (12%) frequentavam, na sua totalidade, escolas pblicas.
Apenas 15,7% dos questionrios distribudos foram entregues
sem resposta. Resultados: Foi encontrada uma prevalncia de
25,45% de sintomas nasais nos ltimos 12 meses (questo "2"
do QE) entre os adolescentes estudados. Quando analisada a
prevalncia da rinite diagnosticada por mdico (rinite alguma
vez - questo "6" do QE), a prevalncia foi de 21,61%. Dos que
afirmaram ter sintomatologia nasal no ltimo ano, mais da metade
(60%) afirmou ter sintomas oculares associados e cerca de
80% admitia interferncia destes sintomas nas suas atividades
dirias. Concluses: Este dado interessante por demonstrar
que em cidade de clima semi-rido do interior do Estado de
Pernambuco, a prevalncia de Rinite alrgica elevada

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVII CONGRESS OF THE EUROPEAN ACADEMY OF ALLERGY ANS CLINICAL IMMUNOLOGY
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Allergy (Copenhagen)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Objective: The aim of this study was to
evaluate if rhinitis and rhinoconjunctivitis
are risk factors for the development of
asthma among Brazilian children evaluated
by the ISAAC phase 3 protocol.
Methods: Adolescents (AD, 13?14 yearold)
from 16 centers (14 Brazilian cities)
were enrolled as standardized by ISAAC
protocol. The prevalence of current asthma
(CA), current rhinitis (CR) and current rhinoconjunctivitis
(CRC) were obtained in
each centre. The association between the
prevalence of CR and of CRC with CA
was evaluated by the Spearman correlation
index. The influence of CR and CRC on
asthma presentation was analyzed by Chisquare
test and expressed as Odds Ratio
(OR) with 95% confidence intervals
(95%CI). The study was approved by all
Local Ethical Committees. In all tests the
level of rejection of the null hypothesis was
5%.
Results: Correlation between CR and CA,
and between CRC and CR were statistically
significant (Spearman?s correlation
coefficient rs = 0.82 [95%CI: 0.60?0.93],
P < 0.0001, and rs = 0.75 [95%CI: 0.47?
0.89], P < 0.0001, respectively). CR was
associated with a significantly increased
risk (Odds ratio) of CA (from 2.19 to
4.36). Similar was observed with regard to
CRC (from 2.73 to 6.04).
Conclusion: In patients with CR or CRC
the risk of developing asthma is high.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Identification of marker allergens in brazilian soy allergic patients
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: IDENTIFICATION OF MARKER ALLERGENS IN BRAZILIAN SOY ALLERGIC PATIENTS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVII CONGRESS OF THE EUROPEAN ACADEMY OF ALLERGY ANS CLINICAL IMMUNOLOGY
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Allergy (Copenhagen)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Background: Soy allergy is established as
one of the most common food allergies.
Therefore, we decided to analyze whether
there are specific protein markers among
Brazilian soy allergic patients, using microarray
techniques.
Method: Thirteen patients presenting with
immediate symptoms after ingestion of soy
formula and IgE reactivity to soy extract
were selected after failing oral food challenges.
Sixteen patients with no symptoms
(negative soy challenge), but presenting
with positive specific IgE to soy (Immuno-
CAP >0.35 kU/l) were used as controls.
In order to allow for simultaneous measurement
of IgE responses, a number of
purified proteins and protein mixes were
used for analysis in a multiplexed capillary-
flow based microarray assay.
Results: Significant differences between
children with symptoms and without symptoms
were found for b-conglycinin (Gly m
5) and glycinin (Gly m 6), the storage proteins
of soybean. b-conglycinin showed
higher response and glycinin, lower
response by the tested patients.
Conclusion: The highest and most prevalent
IgE reactivity in the group of children
with soy allergy was directed to the two
storage proteins of soy, b-conglycinin and
glycinin. Both proteins appear to be good
marker allergens for soy allergy in Brazilian
children.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Ascaris lumbricoides infected children from a urban area in Brazil and interleukin - 10 production in response to aeroallergens
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: ASCARIS LUMBRICOIDES INFECTED CHILDREN FROM A URBAN AREA IN BRAZIL AND INTERLEUKIN- 10 PRODUCTION IN RESPONSE TO AEROALLERGENS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVII CONGRESS OF THE EUROPEAN ACADEMY OF ALLERGY ANS CLINICAL IMMUNOLOGY
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Allergy (Copenhagen)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Background: IL-10 can modulate allergic
reactions in the host. Concerning geohelminths,
the studies diverge about its influence
on symptoms of allergic disease and/
or skin prick test reactivity. Human IL-10
production in response to aeroallergens
during geohelminthic infection is poorly
known. In this study we measured D. pteronyssinus
and B. tropicalis stimulated IL-10
synthesis by peripheral blood mononuclear
cells from low parasitic load infected and
non-infected patients from a Brazilian (Recife)
urban area.
Methods: Geohelminth infected and noninfected
children were detected by stool
examination (Hofmann/Kato-Katz). Blood
sample were harvested for mononuclear
cells purification that were cultured with
Ascaris sp antigen (Asc), D. pteronyssinus
(Dep), B. tropicalis (Bt) and concanavalina
A mitogen (Con A). IL-10 content in cellular
supernatant was measured by ELISA.
Results: Patients were between 9 and
12 year old, 10 male and 11 female. In
infected individual the parasite load was
low. There was no difference between
Ascaris lumbricoides infected and noninfected
in IL-10 synthesis in response to
Asc, Con A or Dep antigens. However, in
response to Blomia tropicalis stimulus there
was a significantly higher IL-10 production
by the non-infected group.
Conclusion: Low parasite load infected
patients from urban Brazilian area have a
lower IL-10 production when stimulated
by B. tropicalis, the most prevalent allergen
in Recife. This could lead to a propensity
for clinical allergic diseases. These findings
strengthens the hypothesis that low
geohelminth load, especially Ascaris
lumbricoides, can predispose to asthma

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Safety, frequency of adverse events and interleukin 10 serum levels after subcutaneous Beta-1-3 Glucan administration in asthmatic children
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: SAFETY, FREQUENCY OF ADVERSE EVENTS AND INTERLEUKIN 10 SERUM LEVELS AFTER SUBCUTANEOUS BETA-1-3 GLUCAN ADMINISTRATION IN ASTHMATIC CHILDREN

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVII CONGRESS OF THE EUROPEAN ACADEMY OF ALLERGY ANS CLINICAL IMMUNOLOGY
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Allergy (Copenhagen)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Background: Beta-1-3 Glucan is a polysaccharide
extracted from a yeast ? Saccharomyces
cerevisiae ? with a possible
immunomodulating action that may 
therapeutic effects on asthma symptoms
and other allergic diseases. An experimental
study on a murine respiratory model
detected a decrease in pulmonary tissue
eosinophilia, as well as a functional
increase in regulatory T cells and IL-10
after glucan use. The objective is evaluate
safety, frequency of adverse events and
interleukin 10 serum levels after subcutaneous
Beta-1-3-glucan administration in mild
to moderate asthmatic children.
Methods: In this open, exploratory study
with blind outcome evaluation, were
included asthmatic children between 6 and
12 years of age with mild to moderate persistent
asthma and inadequate disease control
(rescue medication need more than
two times a week) in spite of inhaled budesonide
400 lg/day. After a 4 week run-in
period, subcutaneous Beta-1-3-glucan injections
were given weekly for the first
4 weeks and than every 2 weeks for the
last 4 weeks. Adverse events were clinically
evaluated weekly and IL-10 levels, measured
by the immunoenzymatic method
(ELISA), were compared before and after
glucan administration.
Results: Were included 20 patients (14
male and 6 female).There were no arm
abscess or serious adverse events that
determined drug administration interruption.
Pain at injection site and nodule formation,
headache, myalgias and fever were
uncommon and transitory. Mean IL-10
levels were 6.4 pg/ml and 11.3 pg/ml before
and after glucan respectively (P = 0.02).
Conclusion: The drug was shown to be a
safe medication in this short term study.
Besides, particulate Beta-1-3-Glucan given
subcutaneously increases serum IL-10 levels
in asthmatics. The possibility that Beta-
1-3 Glucan could be able to modulate
allergic sensitization and have a beneficial
action in restoring Th1 function should be
assessed by means of properly planned
co

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIII Congresso Brasileiro de Gastroenterologia
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Revista Mdica de Minas Gerais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Objetivo: analisar a acurcia dos testes cutneos de hipersensibilidade e
IgE especfica em crianas com APLV e manifestaes clnicas predominantemente
gastrintestinais. Mtodos: Participaram do estudo 192 crianas na
faixa etria de um a cinco anos de idade (mediana dois anos), destas, 122
realizaram o desencadeamento oral aberto ao alimento suspeito. Avaliados
a sensibilidade, especificidade e os valores preditivos positivos (VPP)
e negativos (VNP) dos testes cutneos e da IgE especfica em relao ao
padro-ouro (desencadeamento oral aberto). Todas as crianas realizaram
Skin Prick Test (SPT), IgE especfica e Atopy Patch Test (ATP) para o leite
de vaca, ovo, trigo e amendoim e o desencadeamento oral aberto para o
alimento ao qual a criana estava sensibilizada ou suspeita de sensibilizao
Resultados: Foi confirmada AA em 50 crianas (40,9%). Dentre estes
casos 44/50 (88%) foram protena do leite de vaca. Foram considerados
casos as crianas que apresentaram resposta positiva ao desencadeamento
oral protena do leite de vaca e controles aquelas com resposta negativa.
Apresentaram sintomatologia dentro das primeiras quatro horas do desencadeamento
22/44 (50,0%) crianas. O SPT apresentou 31,8% de sensibilidade,
90,3% de especificidade, 66,7% de VPP e 68,4% de VPN. O ATP 25,0% de
sensibilidade, 81,9% de especificidade, 45,8% de VPP e 64,1% de VPN. A IgE
especfica apresentou, respectivamente, 20,5%, 88,9%, 52,9% e 64,6%. Concluso:
Apesar da dificuldade operacional e do eventual risco da exposio
o desencadeamento oral o melhor Mtodo para diagnosticar APLV, devido
a baixa sensibilidade e VPP dos testes cutneos e da IgE especfica.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: CONCENTRATION OF SERUM INTERFERON-gamma and interleukin-4 IN CHILDREN WITH SUSPECTED OF PROTEIN ALLERGY TO COW'S MILK

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
em animais de laboratrio e seres humanos, tem sido demonstrada na identificao dos
mecanismos imunolgicos envolvidos na alergia protena do leite de vaca. O objetivo
dessa pesquisa foi comparar as concentraes do interferon-gama e interleucina -4 no
sangue perifrico de crianas com e sem alergia protena do leite de vaca. Mtodos:
Crianas com 2-84 meses de idade, com sintomas relacionados ingesto do leite de
vaca, ainda consumindo o leite e derivados, foram includas na pesquisa. Os dados relacionados
 histria clnica ao perfil imunolgico, pela determinao da IgE total e especficas,
e teste de desencadeamento alimentar oral, foram registrados em um formulrio
estruturado. O teste de desencadeamento alimentar oral foi realizado com leite de vaca,
na dose de 0,5g/Kg de protena, ofertado de forma gradual, aps, pelo menos, 15 dias de
dieta isenta de leite de vaca. As crianas foram observadas por at quatro semanas aps
a realizao do teste, para a definio do diagnstico de alergia protena do leite de
vaca. Os pacientes foram agrupados segundo o resultado do teste ?desencadeamento
alimentar oral?. Foram considerados com alergia protena do leite de vaca aqueles em
que houve o reaparecimento do sintoma, que motivou a realizao do teste. Os pacientes
que no reproduziram os sintomas constituram o grupo sem alergia protena do leite
de vaca. A IL-4 E INF-γ foram aferidas pelo ELISA. As citocinas foram expressas como
variveis contnuas, em pg./mL. Os nveis de citocinas entre os grupos com e sem alergia
 protena do leite de vaca e entre menores e maiores de seis meses de idade foram sumarizados
como medianas e comparados pelo teste de Mann-Whitney. Os testes estatsticos
foram considerados significantes quando o valor de p = ou< 0,05. Resultados: De acordo
com o teste de desencadeamento alimentar aberto, 35/65 pacientes (53,8%) foram classificados
com alergia protena do leite de vaca. A mediana de idade para o

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Validity and repeatability of the counting numbers technique from the slow vital capacity in hospitalized individuals

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 25th International Congress of European Respiratory Society
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: European Respiratory Journal

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Introduction or background: The evaluation of slow vital capacity (SVC)
provides important information about the characterization of
pathophysiological conditions of diseases resulting from abnormalities of the
lung-ventilation processes. However, for their evaluation, it is necessary to use
specific equipment expensive, and are not always available to professionals.
The maximum phonation time (MPT) can be an extra option in the evaluation
of the level of lung function. Aims and objectives: To evaluate the validity
and repeatability of the MPT, more specifically the technique of numerical
count (NC) for the measurement of SVC. Methods: This was a cross-sectional
study, crossover and the choice of techniques (NC and spirometry) were
performed randomly. To assess the best cutoff value of NC was plotted a curve
receiver operator characteristic curve (ROC) and calculated the area under this
curve from the value of 20 ml / kg of SVC. For the evaluation of the test-retest
intraclass coefficient index (ICC) was used, the intra-rater method. Results:
We analyzed 516 patients hospitalized for various diseases. In the ROC curve
analysis found the value of 21 in NC with a sensitivity of 97.15% and
specificity of 67.97% (area under the curve = 0.93, p <0.005). The ICC value
for NC was 0.976 with p> 0.005. ? Conclusions: NC is valid and repeatable
measurement for slow vital capacity and could be an interesting alternative in
the absence of specific equipment in hospitalized individuals.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Reliability of phonation maximum time and capacity in slow vital healthy subjects

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 25th International Congress of European Respiratory Society
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: European Respiratory Journal

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Introduction: The measurement of slow vital capacity (SVC) is important to
investigate the occurrence of airway obstruction, assist in preventing and
assessing the clinical outcome of respiratory diseases. However, it is necessary
to use high cost equipment, as spirometer, whose presence can be scarce in
health facilities, emerging the need to seek alternative methods that allow this
action in the absence of equipment. Aims and objectives: To evaluate the
reliability of maximum phonation time using the counting techniques (CT) and
vowel "a" sustained, and compare it to the gold standard by spirometry.
Methods: This was a cross-sectional study conducted in healthy students,
crossover, where the choice of techniques (spirometry, count technique and
vowel "a") was randomly. Data were collected by two examiners on the same
day and after a week, to evaluate the test-retest. Results: The study included 30
healthy subjects, 26 (87%) women and 4 (13%) men. The intraclass correlation
(ICC) between the days to the first reviewer was 0.906, 0.917 and 0.950 (p
<0.005) for the vowel "a", the counting technique and the SVC respectively,
and for the second evaluator was 0.910, 0.858 and 0.972 (p <0.005). The ICC
between the examiners on the same day and after a week for the vowel "a", the
CT and the SVC was 0.913, 0.955, 0.988 (p <0.005) and 0.955, 0.946, 0.962 (p
<0.005) respectively. Conclusions: This study found that the phonation
techniques with the vowel "a" and counting technique as well as SVC, have
excellent reliability, between different examiners and with the same examiners
on different days, would be an alternative in the absence of equipment specific.

Eur Respir

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Level of physical activity in asthmatic in an extremely arid area in the Brazilian Northeast

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 25th International Congress of European Respiratory Society
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: European Respiratory Journal

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Introduction or Background: Asthma is a major respiratory diseases of
childhood, with great social and economic impact in every community around
the world. Aims and objectives: The aim of this study was to evaluate the
influence of physical activity in asthma individually and when combined with
other factors.Methods: This is a cross-sectional study, population based located
in an extremely arid area in the Brazilian Northeast, with representative
probability sample of scholars from public schools, of both sexes and of 12 and
13 years. To identify asthma was used to question the ISAAC, wheezing in the
last 12 months considering current asthma. The level of physical activity was
assessed by the IPAQ questionnaire. The other variables tested with asthma
were gender, family income, mother's schooling, tobacco use, history of
asthma in parents, have allergic rhinitis and eczema. Poisson regression
analysis was used to assess the association between asthma and the explanatory
variables. Results: 1591 students participated in this study 49.7% (791) men
and 50.3% (800) women. had wheezing in the last 12 months 222 (14%)
individuals. There was an association between asthma and family income,
history of asthma in parents, have allergic rhinitis and physical activity level in
the univariate model (p <0.05), but remained only have a history of asthma in
parents, and allergic rhinitis in the model multivariate. (p <0.005). Conclusions:
We found no association between asthma and the level of physical activity.
There was a larger influence between asthma and a history of asthma in parents
and have allergic rhinitis.
426. Respiratory physiotherapy: outcomes in disease and
health

Reliability of phonation maximum time and capacity in slow vital healthy
subjects
Marco Junior, Emilia Costa, Flvio Andrade, Rodrigo Arajo⁵, Angelo

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Association Between Weight Gain and the Prevalence and severity of wheezing and Asthma in the First Year of Life
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Association Between Weight Gain and the Prevalence and severity of wheezing and Asthma in the First Year of Life

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: American Academy of Allergy, Asthma and Immunology
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
RATIONALE: Rapid weight gain in infancy has been recently identified
as a risk factor for asthma in school age children but very few is known
about it?s influence in the severity of wheezing and asthma in infancy.
METHODS: We evaluated associations between different patterns of
weight gain with the prevalence and severity of wheezing and asthma in the
first year of life analyzing answers to the standardized questionnaire from
the International Study of Wheezing in Infants (EISL) from 9.159 parents
living in five cities of Brazil. Data from reported weight at birth and at one
year were converted to weight-for-age z scores (z). Rapid and excessive
weight gain were defined by weight gain greater than 0.67z and 2.01z,
respectively.
RESULTS: Rapid weight gain was found in 55.7% infants and excessive
in 20.8%. Infants with rapid weight gain showed a significantly higher
prevalence of recurrent wheezing (18.9% vs 18.2%) and hospitalization for
wheezing (8.9% vs 7.5%), while infants with excessive weight gain had a
significantly higher prevalence of hospitalization for wheezing (10.1% vs
7.8%), severe wheeze (9.3% vs 8.1%) and medical diagnosis of asthma
(8.7% vs 7.3%). Breastfeeding for at least six months was significantly less
frequent among infants with rapid and excessive weight gain
CONCLUSIONS: The majority of the evaluated infants showed
weight gain above expected in the first year of life. Rapid and excessive
weight gain were significantly associated with more severe patterns
of wheezing and with the medical diagnosis of asthma in the first year of life.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: There are more asthmatics in homes with high cockroach infestation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: There are more asthmatics in homes with high cockroach infestation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Brazilian Journal of Medical and Biological Research

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Although asthma has been commonly associated with sensitivity to cockroaches, a clear causal relationship between asthma, allergy to cockroaches and exposure levels has not been extensively investigated. The objective of the present study was to determine whether asthma occurs more frequently in children living in homes with high cockroach infestation. The intensity of household infestation was assessed by the number of dead insects after professional pesticide application. Children living in these houses in the metropolitan area of Recife, PE, were diagnosed as having asthma by means of a questionnaire based on the ISAAC study. All children had physician-diagnosed asthma and at least one acute exacerbation in the past year. Children of both sexes aged 4 to 12 years who had been living in the households for more than 2 years participated in this transverse study and had a good socioeconomic status. In the 172 houses studied, 79 children were considered to have been exposed to cockroaches and 93 not to have been exposed. Children living in residences with more than 5 dead cockroaches after pesticide application were considered to be at high infestation exposure. Asthma was diagnosed by the questionnaire in 31.6% (25/79) of the exposed group and in 11.8% (11/93) of the non-exposed group (P = 0.001), with a prevalence ratio of 3.45 (95%CI, 1.48-8.20). The present results indicate that exposure to cockroaches was significantly associated with asthma among the children studied and can be considered a risk factor for the disease. Blattella germanica and Periplaneta americana were the species found in 96% of the infested houses.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Although asthma has been commonly associated with sensitivity to cockroaches, a clear causal relationship between asthma, allergy to cockroaches and exposure levels has not been extensively investigated. The present results indicate that exposure to cockroaches was significantly associated with asthma among the children studied and can be considered a risk factor for the disease. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Neonatal BCG vaccine and response to the tuberculin test in BCG vaccinated children in contact with tuberculosis patients in Recife, Brazil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Neonatal BCG vaccine and response to the tuberculin test in BCG vaccinated children in contact with tuberculosis patients in Recife, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This case-control study analyses the association between the tuberculin response and the neonatal BCG vaccine in 330 children under 15 who are home contacts of tuberculosis patients, taking into account risk factors for the transmission of infection. Interviews were conducted with 330 children, their parents or legal guardians. Chest X-rays were taken and the tuberculin test (TT) applied using 0.1 ml of PPD RT23, taking an induration reading of > or = 10 mm as the cut-off point for a positive test result. Prior BCG vaccination was ascertained by observing the presence of a scar on the deltoid region of the right arm. Six children were excluded because they had signs/symptoms of pulmonary tuberculosis, thereby reducing the final sample to 324 children. The multivariate analysis showed that being exposed to a patient with pulmonary lesions with cavities (OR = 3.14; CI: 1.59-6.20; p = 0.000), a positive sputum smear (OR = 3.65; CI: 1.52-8.78; p = 0.002) or a positive culture (OR = 4.42; CI: 1.39-14.1; p = 0.005), being under five (OR = 0.47; CI: 0.22-0.99; p = 0.045) are independently associated with a positive TT. The fact that a prior BCG scar is not associated with a positive response to the TT indicates the need to re-open discussion of the guidelines which exist in many poor countries where tuberculosis is still a serious public health problem. Such guidelines include those issued by the Brazilian Ministry of Health, which considers the child under 15 in contact with a tuberculosis case to be infected only if there is a TT of 10 mm or more and the child received no prior BCG vaccination.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This case-control study analyses the association between the tuberculin response and the neonatal BCG vaccine in 330 children under 15 who are home contacts of tuberculosis patients, taking into account risk factors for the transmission of infection. Interviews were conducted with 330 children, their parents or legal guardians. Such guidelines include those issued by the Brazilian Ministry of Health, which considers the child under 15 in contact with a tuberculosis case to be infected only if there is a TT of 10 mm or more and the child received no prior BCG vaccination.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Sensitization to inhalant and food allergens in Brazilian atopic children by in vitro total and specific IgE assay. Allergy Project--PROAL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Sensitization to inhalant and food allergens in Brazilian atopic children by in vitro total and specific IgE assay. Allergy Project--PROAL

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: OBJECTIVE: To determine the frequency of sensitization to inhalant and food allergens in children seen at Brazilian allergy services. PATIENTS AND METHODS: Total and specific IgE serum levels to inhalant and food allergens (RAST, UniCAP - Pharmacia) were measured in 457 children accompanied in pediatric allergy services and in 62 control children age matched. RAST equal or higher than class 1 was considered as positive (R+). RESULTS: Frequency of R+ was significantly higher among atopics (361/457, 79%) when compared to controls (16/62, 25.8%). There were no differences according to gender. The frequency of R+ to all allergens evaluated was higher among atopics when compared to controls. Significantly higher total IgE serum levels were observed among the atopics with R+ in comparison to those with R-. The frequency of R+ to main inhalant allergens were: D. pteronyssinus = 66.7% x 14.5% (p < 0.05), D. farinae = 64.5% x 17.8% (p < 0.05), B. tropicalis = 55.2% x 19.4% (p < 0.05), cockroach = 32.8% x 9.7% (p < 0.05), and cat = 12% x 8.1%. In relation to food allergens we observed: fish = 29.5% x 11.3% (p < 0.05), egg = 24.4% x 4.8% (p < 0.05), cow's milk = 23.1% x 3.2% (p < 0.05), wheat = 20% x 8.1% (p < 0.05), peanuts = 14% x 4.8% (p < 0.05), soy = 11.8% x 4.8% (p < 0.05), and corn = 10.6% x 4.8% (p < 0.05). With respect of age, food allergen sensitization predominates in young children whereas the inverse occurs with inhalant allergens. CONCLUSIONS: There was a predominant frequency of sensitization to inhalant allergens, mainly house dust mites in the evaluated patients. Food allergens were also responsible for a significant proportion of sensitization, mainly in infant
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: OBJECTIVE: To determine the frequency of sensitization to inhalant and food allergens in children seen at Brazilian allergy services. PATIENTS AND METHODS: Total and specific IgE serum levels to inhalant and food allergens (RAST, UniCAP - Pharmacia) were measured in 457 children accompanied in pediatric allergy services and in 62 control children age matched. RAST equal or higher than class 1 was considered as positive (R+). RESULTS: Frequency of R+ was significantly higher among atopics (361/457, 79%) when compared to controls (16/62, 25.8%). There were no differences according to gender. The frequency of R+ to all allergens evaluated was higher among atopics when compared to controls. Significantly higher total IgE serum levels were observed among the atopics with R+ in comparison to those with R-. The frequency of R+ to main inhalant allergens were: D. pteronyssinus = 66.7% x 14.5% (p < 0.05), D. farinae = 64.5% x 17.8% (p < 0.05), B. tropicalis = 55.2% x 19.4% (p < 0.05), cockroach = 32.8% x 9.7% (p < 0.05), and cat = 12% x 8.1%. In relation to food allergens we observed: fish = 29.5% x 11.3% (p < 0.05), egg = 24.4% x 4.8% (p < 0.05), cow's milk = 23.1% x 3.2% (p < 0.05), wheat = 20% x 8.1% (p < 0.05), peanuts = 14% x 4.8% (p < 0.05), soy = 11.8% x 4.8% (p < 0.05), and corn = 10.6% x 4.8% (p < 0.05). With respect of age, food allergen sensitization predominates in young children whereas the inverse occurs with inhalant allergens. CONCLUSIONS: There was a predominant frequency of sensitization to inhalant allergens, mainly house dust mites in the evaluated patients. Food allergens were also responsible for a significant proportion of sensitization, mainly in infant

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Asthma concepts and epidemiological tools for prevalence researches
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Asthma concepts and epidemiological tools for prevalence researches

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Asthma, as a multifatorial disease, with high prevalence and frequent recurrence, attack people, independently of age, sex and geographical area. Because of lack of consensus about the definition of asthma, many questionnaires have been developed to standardize epidemiological criteria of suspicion and diagnosis. Among them, the European Community Respiratory Health Survey (ECRHS) is an important tool for prevalence studies on adults aged from 20 to 44 years old, that represented a methodological improvement of epidemiological surveys, turning them comparable about time and place. The objectives of this article are to comment the evolution of asthma concepts and its repercussion on epidemiological surveys, as well as to chronicle the tools used on these surveys, emphasizing the importance of ECRHS and presenting epidemiological data of asthma on 351 universitary hospital servers at Recife City -- Pernambuco -- Brazil.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Asthma, as a multifatorial disease, with high prevalence and frequent recurrence, attack people, independently of age, sex and geographical area. Because of lack of consensus about the definition of asthma, many questionnaires have been developed to standardize epidemiological criteria of suspicion and diagnosis. Among them, the European Community Respiratory Health Survey (ECRHS) is an important tool for prevalence studies on adults aged from 20 to 44 years old, that represented a methodological improvement of epidemiological surveys, turning them comparable about time and place. The objectives of this article are to comment the evolution of asthma concepts and its repercussion on epidemiological surveys, as well as to chronicle the tools used on these surveys, emphasizing the importance of ECRHS and presenting epidemiological data of asthma on 351 universitary hospital servers at Recife City -- Pernambuco -- Brazil.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Relationship between BCG scar size and asthma in children?
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Relationship between BCG scar size and asthma in children?

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This case control study was conducted to evaluate any association between the BCG scar size and occurrence of asthma among children between 6-14 years of age. Cases consisted of 90 asthmatic children. Control group included 90 non-asthmatic children from the emergency room service of the same hospital. The BCG scar was measured as the average of the transverse and longitudinal diameters. The results showed that asthmatic subjects have a 3.2 times greater risk exhibiting a scar diameter of < 5mm than non- asthmatic subjects (CI 95% = 1.40 - 7.63; P < 0.01). It was concluded that asthmatic children and adolescents exhibited a greater frequency of an BCG scar diameter of < 5mm than non-asthmatics. Clinical significance of this observation is uncertain.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This case control study was conducted to evaluate any association between the BCG scar size and occurrence of asthma among children between 6-14 years of age. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Ecological correlation among prevalence of asthma symptoms, rhinoconjunctivitis and atopic eczema with notifications of tuberculosis and measles in the Brazilian population.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Ecological correlation among prevalence of asthma symptoms, rhinoconjunctivitis and atopic eczema with notifications of tuberculosis and measles in the Brazilian population.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This study aims to assess the relationship among incidence of tuberculosis and measles, in the general population, within the year of birth and the prevalence of asthma, rhinoconjunctivitis and atopic eczema in teenagers from different Brazilian cities enrolled in the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) phases I and III. Positive answers to the questions: 'Have you had wheezing or whistling in the chest in the past 12 months?', 'In the past 12 months, has this nose problem been accompanied by itchy-watery eyes?' and 'Has this itchy rash at any time affected any of the following places: the folds of the elbows, behind the knees, in front of the ankles, under the buttocks, or around the neck, ears or eyes?' identified the teenagers with asthma, rhinoconjunctivitis, and atopic eczema, respectively. The incidence of tuberculosis and measles, in the general population, observed in the year of birth of the enrolled teenagers (1981/82 and 1988/89) were obtained from governmental agencies: National Foundation of Health (FUNASA) and Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE). They were compared with the prevalence of asthma, rhinoconjunctivitis and atopic eczema reported in both ISAAC phases I and III. Although we observed reduction of the incidence of tuberculosis and measles in the general population in all cities, the prevalence of asthma, rhinoconjunctivitis and atopic eczema remained stable in most of the centers. In Pernambuco and Paran, there has been a significant increase in the prevalence of rhinoconjunctivitis. These data do not corroborate the findings of an inverse relationship between the prevalence of atopic diseases and the decreasing incidence of tuberculosis and measles
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This study aims to assess the relationship among incidence of tuberculosis and measles, in the general population, within the year of birth and the prevalence of asthma, rhinoconjunctivitis and atopic eczema in teenagers from different Brazilian cities enrolled in the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) phases I and III. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nasal symptoms, nasal mucociliar clearance, and benzalkonium chloride
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Nasal symptoms, nasal mucociliar clearance, and benzalkonium chloride

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Alergia e Imunopatologia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Background: Benzalkonium chloride (BZC) has been considered
an innocuous preservative for prescription drugs but lately
has been associated with adverse effects.
Objective: We tested the hypothesis that BZC may affect
nasal mucociliary transport rate in healthy volunteers and
induce nasal symptoms.
Patients and Methods: We performed a double blind, placebo-
controlled, randomized, crossover, single-center trial,
with a three weeks washout period in 43 healthy volunteers
comparing the effect of three weeks use of saline nasal spray
containing benzalkonium chloride 0.01% (S+BZC) to preservative-
free saline (FS), t.i.d., on nasal mucociliary clearance rate.
Evaluations were done at the beginning and the end of each
period by gamma scintigraphy with Technetium99m labeled
Strontium.
Results: Volunteers were followed through the study and
all except one completed the planned observations. Nine had
upper airway infection during the trial and were excluded of
final analysis. Of the remaining subjects, 17 were allocated to
use preservative free saline first and 17 to benzalkonium containing
solution first. The rate of nasal mucociliary clearance
was significantly impaired by benzalkonium chloride with a difference
of 1.23 mm.min-1 (p < 0.01) between periods.
Conclusion: BZC in concentration used in nasal preparations
has shown to impair mucociliary clearance in healthy
individuals after three weeks of use.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Use of the skin prick test and specific immunoglobulin E for the diagnosis of cockroach allergy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Use of the skin prick test and specific immunoglobulin E for the diagnosis of cockroach allergy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: OBJECTIVE: To compare the prevalence of allergy to cockroaches (Blattella germanica and Periplaneta americana) in asthmatic and non-asthmatic children and to determine the degree of agreement between the skin prick test and serum specific IgE levels, as well as to establish the relationship between cockroach allergy and total IgE levels. METHODS: A case-control study involving 76 asthmatic and 42 non-asthmatic children aged between 6 and 14 years was conducted in Recife, Brazil. All individuals were submitted to the skin prick test and to the measurement of specific IgE for B. germanica and P. americana, as well as to the determination of total IgE concentration. RESULTS: Asthmatic children showed a higher frequency of positive skin reactions to B. germanica (27.6 vs. 4.8%) and P. americana (27.6 vs. 2.4%) than non-asthmatic ones. The agreement between the skin prick test and the specific IgE results was reasonable for B. germanica (kappa = 0.25) and weak for P. americana (kappa = 0.17). Those patients who tested positive for cockroaches had a significantly higher geometric mean for total IgE than those who tested negative. The agreement between specific IgE and the skin prick test increased as total IgE levels rose, although some skin tests were negative even when total IgE levels were as high as 5000 kU/l. All determinations of cockroach-specific IgE were positive for total IgE levels greater than 2500 kU/l, even among asymptomatic patients. CONCLUSION: Allergic sensitivity to cockroaches was a predictive factor for asthma severity. The skin prick test is more appropriate for the detection of clinically relevant sensitivity to cockroaches than specific IgE determination

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Anti-IgE monoclonal antibody for the treatment of the asthma and other manifestations related to allergic diseases.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Anti-IgE monoclonal antibody for the treatment of the asthma and other manifestations related to allergic diseases.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
asthma and allergic diseases and the first monoclonal anti-IgE antibody approved for clinical use.
Sources: MEDLINE, a non-systematic search including reviews and original papers, chosen according to their relevance in the authors opinion.
Summary of the findings: The paper emphasizes the central role IgE plays in allergic diseases and the biologicalrationale for its use, the evidence upon which the current recommendations for the use of anti-IgE in uncontrolled asthma are based and its possible future applications, in addition to the recommendation that in clinical practice doses must be
adjusted for weight and serum IgE levels. Omalizumab was approved in Brazil for patients with severe uncontrolled asthma presenting with a positive skin prick test for one or more relevant aeroallergen, or IgE specific to a relevant allergen detected in serum, having a total IgE level of between 30 and 700 UI/mL. For the time being its use should be restricted to patients aged 12 years or more, but there are prospects that it will be licensed for use with children over 6 years old.
Conclusions: Some severe asthma cases cannot be controlled with the regular treatment options aimed at preventing symptoms and exacerbations, and so require frequent or prolonged use of systemic corticosteroids. These
patients may benefit from treatment with anti-IgE, after a meticulous reevaluation of possible reasons for the failure to control asthma.

asthma and allergic diseases and the first monoclonal anti-IgE antibody approved for clinical use.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Rhinitis, sinusitis and asthma: hard to dissociate?
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Rhinitis, sinusitis and asthma: hard to dissociate?

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: lvaro Augusto Souza da Cruz Filho

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this study was to review the literature and to discuss epidemiological and physiopathological aspects and therapeutical implications of an unified approach to allergic rhinosinusitis and asthma. The bibliographic survey was based on the information provided by the following databases: Medline, MD Consult, Highwire, Medscape, LILACS and through direct search over thirty years, using the terms allergic rhinitis and asthma. Fifty-five original articles were selected in the no systematically review addressing the issue of clinical association between allergic rhinusinusitis and asthma. It is noteworthy that in the late years, with the use of specific topical medications for the lower airways or else, to the upper airways, the therapeutical approach has been distinct. However, numerous epidemiological surveys, immunopatological and clinical studies demonstrate the inter-relationship between asthma and allergic rhinossinusitis, characterized by: i) allergic rhinitis is associated to asthma and constitute an independent risk factor for its occurrence; ii) the immunopathological characteristics of allergic rhinitis and asthma are similar; iii) allergic rhinitis and asthma are manifestations of a systemic disease; iv) control of rhinitis favors asthma control. taking into consideration the close inter-relationship between allergic rhinitis and asthma, the approach to diagnosis, treatment and prophylaxis of these illnesses should be integrated. Therapeutical options that allow for the simultaneous control of asthma and allergic rhinitis offer advantages related both to costs and tolerability.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study was to review the literature and to discuss epidemiological and physiopathological aspects and therapeutical implications of an unified approach to allergic rhinosinusitis and asthma. Therapeutical options that allow for the simultaneous control of asthma and allergic rhinitis offer advantages related both to costs and tolerability.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Benzalkonium chloride and nasal mucociliary clearance: a randomized, placebo-controlled, crossover, double-blind trial
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Benzalkonium chloride and nasal mucociliary clearance: a randomized, placebo-controlled, crossover, double-blind trial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Background: Benzalkonium chloride (BKC) has been considered an innocuous preservative for prescription drugs.

Methods: We performed a double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized, crossover, single-center trial with a 3-week washout period in 43 healthy volunteers comparing the effect of 3-week use of saline nasal spray containing BKC 0.01% to preservative-free saline t.i.d. on nasal mucociliary clearance rate. Evaluations were done at the beginning and the end of each period by γ-scintigraphy with technetium99m-labeled strontium.

Results: Nasal mucociliary clearance rate was significantly impaired by BKC with a difference of 1.23 mmmin−1 (p < 0.01) between periods.

Conclusion: BKC in the concentration used in nasal preparations impaired mucociliary clearance in healthy individuals after 3 weeks of use. Presently, when preservative-free alternatives are available, BKC could be a risk without benefit.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

Results: Nasal mucociliary clearance rate was significantly impaired by BKC with a difference of 1.23 mmmin−1 (p < 0.01) between periods.

Conclusion: BKC in the concentration used in nasal preparations impaired mucociliary clearance in healthy individuals after 3 weeks of use. Presently, when preservative-free alternatives are available, BKC could be a risk without benefit.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Total IgE level in respiratory allergy: study of patients at high risk for helminthic infection
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Total IgE level in respiratory allergy: study of patients at high risk for helminthic infection

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Eosinophilia and increased serum IgE levels are indicators of atopy; however, other factors can also play a key role, such as intestinal parasitic infections. This study assesses the relationship between total serum IgE, eosinophil count, and anti-Ascaris IgE in individuals with asthma and/or allergic rhinitis. METHODS: A cross-sectional study was carried out in adolescents with asthma and/or allergic rhinitis. The patients had their total serum IgE, anti-Ascaris IgE and eosinophil count measured. RESULTS: A total of 101 patients aged 12 to 21 years were assessed. Median IgE level was 660 IU/mL (P(25-75) 243.5-1500), and the eosinophil count corresponded to 510 cells/mm(3) (P(25-75) 284-811). Anti-Ascaris IgE was positive in 73% (74/101) of the individuals, but parasitological stool examination yielded positive results in only 33.7% (34/101). The correlation coefficients were the following: 0.34 (p = 0.001) between total IgE level and eosinophil count, 0.52 (p < 0.001) between total IgE level and anti-Ascaris IgE, and 0.26 (p = 0.01) between eosinophil count and anti-Ascaris IgE. The final multiple linear regression model pointed out that anti-Ascaris IgE contributed to a total serum IgE level with a coefficient of determination (adjusted R(2)) of 0.25 (F = 12.35; p < 0.001). This effect occurred regardless of eosinophil count and of the presence of intestinal helminthic infection. CONCLUSION: In patients with respiratory allergy and increased total serum IgE levels living in areas where there is a high risk for helminthic infections, the quantification of anti-Ascaris IgE can be more useful and more insightful than the parasitological stool examination.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Eosinophilia and increased serum IgE levels are indicators of atopy; however, other factors can also play a key role, such as intestinal parasitic infections. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Production of interferon gamma in asthmatic pacients with small bacille Calmette-Guerin scars: a pilot study
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Production of interferon gamma in asthmatic pacients with small bacille Calmette-Guerin scars: a pilot study

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Some studies suggest a decrease in interferon (IFN) gamma production among atopic individuals, and others refer to low IFN-gamma levels as a characteristic of asthma, regardless of the atopic state. Recent research has indicated a relation between asthma and a tendency toward a bacille Calmette-Guerin (BCG) vaccine scar with a small diameter, suggesting an association of this illness with the low production of IFN-gamma. The aim of this study was to check the hypothesis that asthmatic patients with a small BCG scar present low IFN-gamma production. This work was a quasi-experimental study. The capacity to produce IFN-gamma among 12 asthmatic patients with an average BCG vaccine scar diameter <5 mm was compared with 7 nonasthmatic individuals with scars > or =5 mm using whole blood cells stimulated by purified protein derivative (PPD), phorbol myristate acetatelionomycin (PMA/Iono) and medium (no stimulus). The study also analyzed the relation between IFN-gamma production after PPD stimulation and eosinophil count, total IgE, and dust-mite-specific IgE levels. The asthmatic patients presented a decrease in IFN-gamma production in comparison with a control group after PPD stimulation (p < 0.02). However, the same was not observed when PMA/Iono stimulation was used or when no stimulation was used. Asthmatic patients with small BCG scars showed a decrease in IFN-gamma production, suggesting that there may be an intrinsic characteristic of these patients.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Safety of anti-immunoglobulin E therapy with omalizumab in allergic patients at risk of geohelminth infection
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Safety of anti-immunoglobulin E therapy with omalizumab in allergic patients at risk of geohelminth infection

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: BACKGROUND: Although the role of immunoglobulin E (IgE) in immunity against helminth parasites is unclear, there is concern that therapeutic antibodies that neutralize IgE (anti-IgE) may be unsafe in subjects at risk of helminth infection. OBJECTIVE: We conducted an exploratory study to investigate the safety of omalizumab (anti-IgE) in subjects with allergic asthma and/or perennial allergic rhinitis at high risk of intestinal helminth infection. The primary safety outcome was risk of infections with intestinal helminths during anti-IgE therapy. METHODS: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial was conducted in 137 subjects (12-30 years) at high risk of geohelminth infection. All subjects received pre-study anthelmintic treatment, followed by 52 weeks' treatment with omalizumab or placebo. RESULTS: Of the omalizumab subjects 50% (34/68) experienced at least one intestinal geohelminth infection compared with 41% (28/69) of placebo subjects [odds ratio (OR) 1.47, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.74-2.95, one-sided P=0.14; OR (adjusted for study visit, baseline infection status, gender and age) 2.2 (0.94-5.15); one-sided P=0.035], providing some evidence for a potential increased incidence of geohelminth infection in subjects receiving omalizumab. Omalizumab therapy was well tolerated, and did not appear to be associated with increased morbidity attributable to intestinal helminths as assessed by clinical and laboratory adverse events, maximal helminth infection intensities and additional anthelmintic requirements. Time to first infection (OR 1.30, 95% CI 0.79-2.15, one-sided P=0.15) was similar between treatment groups. Infection severity and response to anthelmintics appeared to be unaffected by omalizumab therapy. CONCLUSIONS: In this exploratory study of allergic subjects at high risk of helminth infections, omalizumab therapy appeared to be safe and well tolerated, but may be associated with a modest increase in the incidence of geohelminth infection.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Prevalence of atopic eczema and related symptoms in Brazilian schoolchildren: results from the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) phase 3
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Prevalence of atopic eczema and related symptoms in Brazilian schoolchildren: results from the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) phase 3

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Investigational Allergology & Clinical Immunology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: BACKGROUND: International comparisons of the prevalence of atopic eczema and related symptoms are scarce. The standardized protocol of the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) facilitates investigation of prevalence all over the world. OBJECTIVE: To apply the ISAAC written questionnaire to evaluate the prevalence of atopic eczema and related symptoms among 6-7 year-old children and 13-14 year-old adolescents living in 20 Brazilian cities. METHODS: The ISAAC written questionnaire was filled in by 23,422 children aged 6-7 years and 58,144 adolescents aged 13-14 years living in 2 population centers in the north, 8 in the northeast, 1 in the midwest, 5 in the southeast, and 5 in the south. RESULTS: The prevalence of flexural eczema (itchy rash ever in characteristic places in the last 12 months) ranged from 5.3% to 13.0% for children and was lower among the adolescents (range, 3.4%-7.9%). Among children, the highest rates were observed in population centers in the northeast, mainly along the coast. Among adolescents the highest rates were observed in the north and northeast, mainly in Natal, Aracaju, and Vitria da Conquista. The northeastern countryside had higher prevalence rates of severe eczema (kept awake at night by this itchy rash in the last 12 months) in comparison to northeastern coastal centers. There was a significant correlation between the prevalence of flexural eczema and severe eczema for both age groups, separately (6-7 year-olds, prho= 0.756, P<.004; 13-14 year-olds, rho=0.874, P<.0001) or grouped (6-7 plus 13-14 years-olds, rho=0.696, P<.0001). CONCLUSION: The prevalence of eczema and related symptoms is variable in Brazil, where the highest prevalence is found in the north and northeast; on the other hand, a higher prevalence of severe eczema was observed in Brazilian centers in the south.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Cockroach allergy: risk factor for asthma severity. Authors' reply
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Cockroach allergy: risk factor for asthma severity. Authors' reply

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Prevalence of symptoms of asthma, rhinitis, and atopic eczema among Brazilian children and adolescents identified by the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) - Phase 3.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Prevalence of symptoms of asthma, rhinitis, and atopic eczema among Brazilian children and adolescents identified by the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) - Phase 3.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: OBJECTIVES: To determine the prevalence of symptoms of asthma, rhinitis, and atopic eczema among schoolchildren aged 6 to 7 years and adolescents aged 13 to 14 years in 20 Brazilian cities by using the standardized ISAAC written questionnaire, and to assess the association of this prevalence with latitude, altitude and average annual temperature of collaborating centers. METHODS: Schoolchildren and adolescents from five Brazilian regions participated in the study, totaling 23,422 ISAAC questionnaires answered by schoolchildren's parents and 58,144 questionnaires answered by adolescents. The values for latitude, altitude and average annual temperature were obtained from the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics. RESULTS: The mean prevalence rates among schoolchildren and adolescents were respectively 24.3 and 19.0% for active asthma; 12.6 and 14.6% for rhinoconjunctivitis; and 8.2 and 5.0% for atopic eczema. A significant negative association was observed between latitude and physician-diagnosed asthma among schoolchildren, severe asthma, physician-diagnosed asthma, eczema and atopic eczema among adolescents. No association with altitude was found. CONCLUSIONS: The prevalence of asthma, rhinitis and atopic eczema in Brazil varies considerably. Higher prevalence rates, especially of asthma and eczema, were found at centers located closer to the equator.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: OBJECTIVES: To determine the prevalence of symptoms of asthma, rhinitis, and atopic eczema among schoolchildren aged 6 to 7 years and adolescents aged 13 to 14 years in 20 Brazilian cities by using the standardized ISAAC written questionnaire, and to assess the association of this prevalence with latitude, altitude and average annual temperature of collaborating centers. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Hypersensitivity to molds in asthmatic children from a community of Recife, Pernambuco
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Hypersensitivity to molds in asthmatic children from a community of Recife, Pernambuco

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Sade Materno Infantil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: OBJECTIVES: to identify prick test hypersensitivity to molds in asthmatic school children in a low-income urban community. METHODS: thirteen children who had more than three asthma attacks in the last 12 months from March'1997 to June'1998 were evaluated. These children were selected from a previous cross-sectional survey studying 123 children from 6 to 10 years old residing at the low-income urban community of Campo do Banco-Vrzea, Recife, Pernambuco. The 123 children were tested by the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood survey to determine asthma. The 13 asthmatic children selected were evaluated with the prick test for immediate hypersensitivity to six standard mold extracts: aspergillus mix, penicillium mix, hormodendrum cladosporidiodes, alternaria tenius, helminthosporium interseminatum and mold mix. RESULTS: there were 12 mold-sensitive children from the group of 13 children, showing a positive result to at least one of the mold extracts used (12/13). Mold extracts of higher positive incidence were: Aspergillus mix (7/13), Penicillium mix (6/13) and Hormodendrum Cladosporidiodes (5/13). CONCLUSIONS: the evaluated children had high prick test reactivity to mold extracts. The findings indicate the need for additional studies to analyze a possible association between fungal exposure and asthma
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: OBJECTIVES: to identify prick test hypersensitivity to molds in asthmatic school children in a low-income urban community. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Prevalncia de asma em funcionrios de hospital universitrio avaliada por meio de questionrio de sade respiratria da Comunidade Europia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: OBJETIVO: Determinar a prevalncia de asma brnquica em funcionrios de um hospital universitrio, com idades entre 20 e 44 anos, segundo os critrios do European Community Respiratory Health Survey. MTODOS: Atravs de estudo descritivo, prospectivo, aleatrio e estratificado de prevalncia, foram analisados os questionrios de 351 funcionrios do Hospital das Clnicas da Universidade Federal de Pernambuco, entre abril e outubro de 2002. Foram consideradas as variveis de caracterizao amostral, as independentes referentes a sinais e sintomas e a dependente (asma, caracterizada pela informao de crise, diagnosticada por mdico, nos doze meses anteriores pesquisa). RESULTADOS: A prevalncia de asma foi de 10,7 por cento. Dispnia noturna, sensao de aperto torcico e tosse noturna foram os sintomas mais freqentes, com significncia s no sexo feminino (respectivamente p = 0,03, p = 0,04 e p = 0,001). Dispnia noturna, sibilos nos ltimos doze meses, dispnia com sibilos e uso de medicao para asma predominaram entre 20 e 29 anos, com significncia para os dois ltimos sintomas (p < 0,001). Houve 35 casos de subtratamento de asma (10,7 por cento). CONCLUSO: Este estudo, pioneiramente analisando casustica de funcionrios de um hospital universitrio de pas em desenvolvimento, mostra que a prevalncia de asma foi um pouco mais elevada que a encontrada na literatura e sugere que o trabalho em hospital universitrio no reduz a freqncia de subtratamento

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Trato gastrintestinal e alergia alimentar na infncia

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Alergia e Imunopatologia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Objetivo: Discutir aspectos fisiopatolgicos, sintomas clnicos, diagnstico e tratamento das manifestaes gastrintestinais da alergia alimentar em crianas. Mtodos: Busca ativa e pesquisa na base de dados Medline, abrangendo os ltimos dez anos, de artigos originais e de reviso que abordem alergia alimentar e alteraes gastrintestinais. Resultados e Concluses: Alergia alimentar comum nas crianas, especialmente nos primeiros anos de vida. Vrios sintomas podem ocorrer, mas as manifestaes gastrintestinais, isoladas ou associadas a sintomas de outros rgos, so muito freqentes e incluem refluxo gastroesofgico, enterocolite, enteropatia perdedora de protena, proctocolite e constipao crnica. As evidncias atuais apontam que o desenvolvimento destas manifestaes podem ser devido a processo inflamatrio da mucosa intestinal ou alterao da motilidade gastrintestinal secundria a mecanismo imune. Alguns exames podem ser solicitados para confirmar a presena de alergia alimentar e possveis alteraes da motilidade gastrintestinal associadas ao sintoma vigente. O tratamento ideal a dieta isenta do alimento agressor

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Asthma-related hospitalizations and lack of outpatient follow-up treatment
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Asthma-related hospitalizations and lack of outpatient follow-up treatment

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Objective: To determine whether the children and adolescents with acute asthma attacks admitted to two public hospitals in the city of Recife, Brazil underwent outpatient follow-up treatment for the prevention and control of asthma. Methods: A prospective case series study of hospitalized patients with asthma. The patients were asked to complete a questionnaire at admission in order to determine the frequency of prophylactic outpatient follow-up treatment. Patients presenting two or more attacks of asthma that were responsive to bronchodilators were classified as having asthma. Results: In the intervals between asthma attacks, 67% (112/167 - data regarding 2 patients were not available) of the patients had been treated only in the emergency room. Although 53.3%(89/167 - data regarding 2 patients were not provided) of the patients had been referred to outpatient treatment, only 16% (27/169) had visited an outpatient asthma clinic regularly for preventive treatment, and only 13% (22/169) had used prophylactic medication. Conclusion: Most of the children and adolescents hospitalized with asthma had not undergone preventive outpatient follow-up treatment. Various problems related to the health care system, such as non-referral for outpatient follow-up treatment at hospital discharge, limited access to outpatient clinics, and the cost of prophylactic medication, might have contributed to the low rate of outpatient follow-up treatment in the population studied. Public health care policies that allow asthma control programs to work effectively should be implemented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Objective: To determine whether the children and adolescents with acute asthma attacks admitted to two public hospitals in the city of Recife, Brazil underwent outpatient follow-up treatment for the prevention and control of asthma. Is it possible to prevent food allergy?
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Is it possible to prevent food allergy?

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The rising prevalence of food allergy has led to particular interest in intervention studies designed to prevent its onset. These studies have been performed on high-risk children in particular. Primary intervention studies are difficult to perform due to the complexity of design and selection of patients. Analyses and comparison of the results of different studies are exceedingly difficult to interpret owing to differences in selection criteria, primary outcomes and methods used to confirm the diagnosis of allergy. In spite of these limitations, there are several prospective, randomised, blind
studies that have demonstrated the benefits of food allergy prevention. In these studies dietary intervention in the first 4 to 6 months promoted a decrease in infantile atopic eczema and cow?s milk allergy. While some dietary restrictions are recommended for all infants, particular measures should be applied to high risk children. The aim of this study was
to review the literature on primary prevention of food allergy focusing on breast and formula feeding, maternal diet in pregnancy and while breast-feeding, age of solid food introduction and probiotics

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Oral health among adolescents: aspects relating to hygiene, dental cavities and periodontal disease in the cities of Recife and Feira de Santana, Brazil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Oral health among adolescents: aspects relating to hygiene, dental cavities and periodontal disease in the cities of Recife and Feira de Santana, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: BJECTIVE: To characterize the oral health in adolescents in the cities of Recife and Feira de Santana, Northeast Brazil by assessment of personal hygiene and dental cavities and periodontal disease. METHOD: Forty adolescents between ten and eighteen years old were assessed through an exploratory study run in Recife in 2005. In Feira de Santana, 971 adolescents (twelve years old) were examined through a cross section study in 2002. It was assessed cavity status through the number of cavitied, missing and filled teeth, visible dental plaque, bleeding gums and periodontal status. The analysis was based on Chi-Square, Kruskall-Wallis and Fisher tests, with a confidence interval of 95%. RESULTS: The most of adolescents followed oral hygiene practices three times a day. The DMTF values presented a median of 1.5 in Recife and averages of 1.89 in state schools, 2.17 in municipal schools and 2.39 in private schools in Feira de Santana. The bleeding gum in Recife presented a median of 27%, and in Feira de Santana the healthy sextant averages of 4.36, 4.08 and 5.16 in state, municipal and private schools respectively. CONCLUSION: The frequency of the dental cavities was low, with most of the adolescents reporting good habits of oral hygiene and favorable periodontal conditions.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: BJECTIVE: To characterize the oral health in adolescents in the cities of Recife and Feira de Santana, Northeast Brazil by assessment of personal hygiene and dental cavities and periodontal disease. METHOD: Forty adolescents between ten and eighteen years old were assessed through an exploratory study run in Recife in 2005. In Feira de Santana, 971 adolescents (twelve years old) were examined through a cross section study in 2002. It was assessed cavity status through the number of cavitied, missing and filled teeth, visible dental plaque, bleeding gums and periodontal status. The analysis was based on Chi-Square, Kruskall-Wallis and Fisher tests, with a confidence interval of 95%. RESULTS: The most of adolescents followed oral hygiene practices three times a day. The DMTF values presented a median of 1.5 in Recife and averages of 1.89 in state schools, 2.17 in municipal schools and 2.39 in private schools in Feira de Santana. The bleeding gum in Recife presented a median of 27%, and in Feira de Santana the healthy sextant averages of 4.36, 4.08 and 5.16 in state, municipal and private schools respectively. CONCLUSION: The frequency of the dental cavities was low, with most of the adolescents reporting good habits of oral hygiene and favorable periodontal conditions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Prevalence of symptoms of asthma, rhinitis, and atopic eczema among adolescents living in urban and rural areas in different regions of Brazil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Prevalence of symptoms of asthma, rhinitis, and atopic eczema among adolescents living in urban and rural areas in different regions of Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Background:In Brazil, studies evaluating the prevalence
of asthma and allergic diseases among children
living in rural area compared to urban area are rare.
Some authors identified as risk factors for higher prevalence
of current wheezing to have a family history of
asthma, to have contact with pets, and being student in
urban school. The International Study of Asthma and
Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) phase 3 has shown higher
prevalence of wheezing, nasal symptoms and cutaneous
rash in the last 12 months in centers from Northern
(N) and Northeastern (NE) regions of Brazil.
Objective:To evaluate if adolescents with similar genetic
background, living in a rural area are protected
against the development of symptoms of asthma, rhinitis,
and atopic eczema when compared to those living
an urban area in the same region of the country.
Subjects and Method:Adolescents (13-14 yearold)
living in Caruaru (Pernambuco) and in Santa
Maria (Rio Grande do Sul) were enrolled in this study
(2002-2003). The adolescents filled in the ISAAC
written questionnaire (WQ), previously translated
and validated to the Brazilian culture (30-32). Data obtained
were transcribed manually into a database
(Epi-Info) supplied by ISAAC's coordinators and were
statistically analyzed by the SSPS-12 software.
Results:The prevalence of asthma related symptoms
were higher among those adolescents living in
the urban centers in comparison to the rural ones.
These differences were significant for wheezy ever,
wheezy in the last 12 months, asthma ever, and
wheezy with exercise in Caruaru and for wheezy ever
and asthma ever, in Santa Maria. Comparing urban areas,
the prevalence of asthma related symptoms in
Caruaru was higher than in Santa Maria, except for
wheezy ever and wheezy with exercise. The opposite
was observed comparing rural areas: the prevalence of
asthma (except for nocturnal cough) was higher in Santa
Maria despite lesser severity of symptoms in this city.
